climbs.name: Xdono
climbs.fa: Sean Woods, Viktor Kramar, Jim Phillips 2017

content.description: Take an easy wide crack and then jog left on slabby climbing to chains.
content.protection: Gear to 2". Gets quite runout after the wide crack runs out, at least compared to other climbing in the area. 2 chains at the top.
content.location: Start at a wide juggy crack on the left hand side of the wall.

climbs.name: Pinocchio Di Christo
climbs.fa: Sean Woods, Viktor Kramar, Jim Phillips 2017

content.description: Steep jugs at the start gets you to easier climbing that traverses a little left to anchor chains. If setting up a TR, consider a directional on the 2nd bolt.
content.protection: Couple-ish bolts, with gear to 2" above. Bolts with chains for anchors.
content.location: Look for bolts on a steep / overhanging bulge on the ground.

climbs.name: Mossolinni
climbs.fa: Damon Lowell, Viktor Kramar, Sean Woods, Jim Phillips; 2017

content.description: Move past 3 bolts, ascending the short wall pulling on big holds and the occasional horizontal. Optional finger sized cam is not really necessary before last bolt.
content.location: Far left side of Little Italy, just left of the two trees forming a 'v' that the book mentions. Look for the three bolts.

content.description: A steeper route with two fun roofs or bulges to pull over. Well protected and with nice resting stances before each big move.
content.location: The farthest right bolt line at Little Italy.

content.description: Cool little route that heads up blocky cracks through a slight overhang. Good jams and good pro!
content.protection: Gear to BD #3... might want two #3's or a #3 and a #4, if you don't want to bump
content.location: Far right side of Little Italy, just left of the bolt line for the 5.11- (Fotoromanza), which it shares chains with.
